titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Alfred William Douglass Diary

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Alfred William Douglass was an educator in Nashville, Tennessee. He graduated from the University of Nashville in 1842 and worked as a tutor for the institution for several years after his graduation. In January 1849, Douglass and James L. Meigs opened a private school, teaching English, Classical Studies, and Mathematics.
He died of cholera on August 23, 1849.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains one handwritten, penciled, notebook which represents class notes taken by Alfred William Douglass while a student at University of Nashville, dated November 20, 1841.
The notebook contains 118 numbered pages of history, theology, and poetry notes.
